isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Diamond Logic™ Engine Brake - Removal - Brake Assembly

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle.

note.para: For information regarding the removal or installation of adjacent components, refer to the following service procedures located in other sections of this manual:

step1.para: Unclip and disconnect each injector electrical connector from the brake housing and valve cover gasket and place aside.

figure.caption: Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor electrical connector

step1.para: Unclip and disconnect the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor electrical connector from brake housing and valve cover gasket (rear).

figure.caption: Brake shutoff valve assembly electrical connector

step1.para: Unclip and disconnect brake shutoff valve electrical connector from brake housing and valve cover gasket.

figure.caption: Brake Control Pressure (BCP) sensor electrical connector

step1.para: Unclip and disconnect Brake Control Pressure (BCP) sensor electrical connector from brake housing and valve cover gasket (front).

note.para: The ICP and BCP sensors are identical and share the same part number.

step1.para: Loosen all brake housing bolts (M8 x 90) in a circular pattern beginning from either end.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, have an assistant help remove or install the engine brake assembly when working within the chassis.

step1.para: Remove all bolts and lift brake assembly straight up just enough to drain as much oil out of brake assembly before lifting it away from cylinder head.
Prior to disassembly, clean outside of brake assembly using appropriate solvent .
